required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Photobiomodulation and Manual Therapy Alone or Combined in TMD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Photobiomodulation and Manual Therapy Alone or Combined in TMD Patients: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study was to investigate the effect of photobiomodulation (PBM) and manual therapy (MT) isolated or combined in the reduce of pain, the improve of mandibular movements, the psychosocial aspects and the anxiety symptoms of patients with TMD.

detailed_description.textblock: Temporomandibular disorders (TMD) is a complex and multifactorial disease. Therapeutic modalities, as PBM and MT, expected to relief of symptoms, improve of function and reduce the impact of the disease in patient's life. Fifty-one TMD patients were randomly allocated to three groups: PBM group (n=18) using 808 nm, 100 milliwatt (mW), 13.3 J ∕cm2, 4 J per point), MT group (n=16) with 21 minutes sessions of MT of the masticatory muscles and TMJ and Combined Therapy group (CT) (n=17) applying the 2 protocol described above. All treatments were done three times a week for four consecutive weeks. Evaluations were performed at baseline, during the treatment (days 7, 14, 21, and 28) and follow up (day 60 and day 90). Visual analogue scale (VAS), Research Diagnostic Criteria (RDC/TMD) Axis I and II, Beck anxiety inventory (BAI) were used in different moments of evaluation time.

primary_outcome.description: The Visual Analog Scale was used for the assessment changes on levels of pain and consist in a straight horizontal with 100 mm, orientated from the left (no pain) to the right (the worst pain). VAS were applied at baseline (day 0), during the treatment (days 7, 14, 21, and 28) and follow up (day 60 and day 90).

secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis I was used to provide information on jaw movements. This questionnaire were applied at baseline (day 0), during the treatment (days 7, 14, 21, and 28) and follow up (day 60 and day 90).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on location and intensity of pain
secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis I was used to provide information on location of pain at muscle and joint palpation. This questionnaire were applied at baseline (day 0), during the treatment (days 7, 14, 21, and 28) and follow up (day 60 and day 90).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on Intensity of chronic pain
secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis II was used to provide information on psychosocial aspects of TMD , which groups the patients into four domains (D): intensity of chronic pain (D1). This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on levels of depression symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis II was used to provide information on psychosocial aspects of TMD, which groups the patients into four domains (D): degree of depression symptoms (D2) This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on Nonspecific physical symptoms with pain
secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis II was used to provide information on psychosocial aspects of TMD, which groups the patients into four domains (D): Nonspecific physical symptoms with pain (D3a) This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on Nonspecific physical symptoms without pain
secondary_outcome.description: RDC/TMD Axis II was used to provide information on psychosocial aspects of TMD, which groups the patients into four domains (D): Nonspecific physical symptoms without pain (D3b). This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

RDC/TMD Axis II was used to provide information on psychosocial aspects of TMD, which groups the patients into four domains (D): Mandibular function (D4). This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

Beck anxiety inventory (BAI) is a questionnaire with 21 multiple-choice items addressing how the patient felt in the previous week regarding common symptoms of anxiety. This questionnaire were applied at baseline and follow up (day 90).

arm_group.description: Gallium-aluminium-arsenide (GaAlAs) diode laser (MM Optics Recover, São Carlos, São Paulo, Brazil) with a wavelength of 808 nm, punctual contact mode,spot size of 0.03 cm2, power output of 100 mW, output density of 333 mW∕cm2, energy density of 13.3 J ∕cm2, 40 s exposure time per point, and 4 Joules (J) of total energy per point. 18 individuals

At masticatory muscles were performed circular movements, slip and compression with fingers movements. At the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) was performed a caudal distraction with anterior projection, placing the thumb on the second or third molar. 16 individuals.
Applied the protocols of PBM group and immediately after, to MT group. 17 individuals.

intervention.description: PBM was applied, three times a week for four consecutive weeks at 5 points in the TMJ region: superior, anterior, lateral, posterior and postero inferior to the condyle. In addition, all patients received laser application in the temporal muscle (anterior, middle and posterior), in the masseter (upper, middle and lower portion) and insertion of the medial pterygoid.

Patients were submitted to MT at temporal, masseter and pterygoid medial from both sides, during 3 minutes each muscle group (Extraoral) and at masseter and lateral pterygoid (Intraoral) for 3 minutes, each total 21 minutes. MT on the TMJ region was performed for 1 minute and 3 repetitions during three times a week .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- TMD myogenic and arthrogenic diagnosis based in RDC/TMD Axis I analysis
- Pain in temporomandibular joint (TMJ)
- Limitation in mouth opening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current dental or physical treatment
- Polyarthritis and other rheumatic diseases
- Use of anti-inflammatory and muscle relaxant

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul
